Key Match Events: Immanuel Quickley scored 12 of his 21 points in the fourth quarter.
Ochai Agbaji had another strong game, tying Quickley’s 21 points while filling up the stat sheet with seven boards, three dimes, and two steals.
Bruno Fernando infused the team with much-needed energy, allowing the Raptors to mount an 18-6 run in the fourth to tie the game.
Norman Powell and James Harden led all scorers with 24 points apiece, combining for 22 free throws.
Ivica Zubac finished the night with 14 points, 12 boards, and three blocks.
Kevin Porter Jr. poured in 15 points, six boards, and five dimes for the Clippers.
Norman Powell’s trifecta gave the Clippers a 100-95 lead with two minutes left.
Quickley knotted the game at 102 with 35 seconds remaining.
Harden was sent to the line with 28 seconds remaining, splitting his freebies and giving the Clippers a two-point lead.
Powell split his freebies again, giving the Clippers a 105-102 lead.
Poeltl made his first shot and strategically missed the second, but missed the put-back shot, ending the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Toronto Raptors suffered a heartbreaking 103-105 loss to the Los Angeles Clippers.
Several questionable coaching decisions and team management issues, especially in the final moments, proved costly for the Raptors.
The Raptors drop their third straight loss, tanking their record to 2-8 through ten games, and are winless on the road (0-5).
